author: {'steamid': '76561198074344196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1708737299}
review:
Playing this felt like playing a bad game out of the last zentury. I mean I didn't expect the best grafics or physics, but it was definately worse than i thought.
The last mission is way to difficult [SPOILER ] The Spaceshuttle starts to tip over so fast that there is nearly no time to react [/SPOILER].
All in all for me it was just not worth it and i even played it again after some time to give it another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023023915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 335, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1647829752}
review:
Light simulator to kill time, it can be fun and relaxing, however the mission with the crawler transporter is just too tedious,  I read in real life that the crawler goes at 1 km per hour, but in the game you dont have a way to control the speed and keep it stable and you can reach 5 km per hour. so the Space shuttle will fall again and again.

It was interesting to know the machines tho.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069529786', 'num_games_owned': 1188, 'num_reviews': 618, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1642554697}
review: Interesting concept, old game and dated design. The giant machines are pretty interesting to use and sometimes aggravating to drive. Look at you Mission 1. It has elements of a sim style game but draws some aspects of an arcade style sim instead. Got stuck on one of the snow levels and just got fed up with trying to clear the wall. unclear in what needed to be cleared out and it takes painfully long to do some of the tasks. Again, good concept...poor design.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041516169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1640519469}
review: The machines have specific points where you use them, so it's not as free-form as I was hoping. They are cool looking, but only using a machine from point A to B is boring. For instance, the excavator drives ahead, then mines a specific part on the mountain, and that's it; you can't even dig up the ground for funzies. I hope this was bought during a previous sale, as it's maybe $7 max.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156662267', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1605171369}
review: Fun little Simulator, expect to finish the entire game in under 4 hrs.  It has story driven missions that must be done a certain way so don't expect a sandbox style sim.  Game is getting old but graphics are not too shabby, and controls are easy to use, Steering wheel is also compatible.  Super overpriced for what the game gives but hey, if your like me and must have every simulator in your library...... go add it :)  overall rating  7/10

review:
Sou um grande fÃ£ de simuladores de veÃ­culos, mas este realmente me decepcionou.

Explico.

Eu jÃ¡ tenho o jogo faz alguns anos mas somente ontem eu fui tirar um tempo para jogar direito. E que coisa mais mal otimizada... a ideia Ã© interessante, as mÃ¡quinas que aparecem em vÃ­deos e telas enchem os olhos (acho atÃ© que foi por isso que eu comprei) mas a ausÃªncia de um modo livre prejudica todo o gameplay. 

A missÃ£o inicial Ã© cansativa e chata, onde se passa mais tempo a pÃ© do que dentro de uma mÃ¡quina efetivamente fazendo alguma coisa. Quando se sobe em escadas a pÃ©, quando se gira a cÃ¢mera para posicionar onde estÃ¡ indo o movimento Ã© tÃ£o frenÃ©tico que Ã© fÃ¡cil cair e perder esta parte de progresso.

Os movimentos das mÃ¡quinas sÃ£o lentos por serem mÃ¡quinas grandes, ok. Mas tambÃ©m Ã© estressante.

O modo livre seria muito mais interessante para poder conhecer todas as mÃ¡quinas e aproveitar melhor a ideia. Ou entÃ£o a possibilidade de escolher qual tipo de missÃ£o fazer.

Enfim, o jogo Ã© muito engessado. Se tivesse algumas mudanÃ§as no gameplay a experiÃªncia iria ser muito melhor.

Se recomendo? SÃ³ em uma promoÃ§Ã£o. Definitivamente nÃ£o vale o preÃ§o cheio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198824302304', 'num_games_owned': 886, 'num_reviews': 552, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1599315542}
review:
Very fun game nd a lot of cool and big machines to control. Nice controls, very nice music, looks are kinda mediocre.
When I bought the game I didn't exactly what the game would be like when you play it so here is a little description of what the game is like:
It's actually not freeplay, there isn't even free play mode, there is just story mode and time trial. (all chapters are individually erplayable) in story mode you will do a lot of stuff with huge machines to prepare for the take-off of a space shuttle (you don't get to control the shuttle itself) So you start by sollecting ore, then you bring the ore to some factory but on the road you suddenly find that fallen down trees or snow is ablocking your path, so you take a cutter machine or a bulldozer and get rid of it and continue your way.

The mission design may sound a little silly, but it's actually really good, and although nothing in the game is really hard (besides maybe getting gold on the time trial) there is a little bit of increase in difficulty over the course of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132792574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 319, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1585242452}
review: Giant Machines 2017 is one of those random simulators that were popular a few years back, this time focused on giant industrial vehicle operation. True to form, it's janky, ugly, often extremely tedious for no reason whatsoever, and not at all true-to-life despite that theoretically being the appeal of such games. It's kind of adorably bad (especially the hilariously nonsensical plot, in which you do literally all of the work to launch a space shuttle, including shutting down several disaster sites on the day of launch), and I guess some of the vehicles are pretty cool, but I still cannot recommend it under any circumstances.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131923285', 'num_games_owned': 509, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1585214124}
review:
This is not a sim by any means, and the story makes absolutely zero sense.
There's some parts which are tedious and annoying, but over all it's fun enough - but buy it on special.
Yes, there's some bugs, and with only the one story line and no sandbox mode, replayability for me is pretty much non-existent, but for the $2 it cost me, I've had my fun out of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024970562', 'num_games_owned': 873, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1678534795}
review:
(half thumbs-up)

Take the cranes in GTA San Andreas, and make them an entire game. There is spectacle to be had, and in parts, some fun finesse. The start and end are the highlights. The middle part, with the excavator, can be tedious. I got most of what I wanted out of it with the Giant Bomb Quick Look, but I'd still recommend trying if it seems interesting to you. Just know these are, um, giant machines, and they lumber as such.

Tech info: The game's Vsync option seems to lock to 30 FPS.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995222620', 'num_games_owned': 1032, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1578794583}
review:
What's not to like about a game that rewards you with an achievement for finding all of the dumb ways to die in it?! (I only found one of them accidentally) :D

I got this as part of the 'made in Poland' bundle - it's the first game I've played from that bundle but if this is anything to go by I'm thinking it looks like I made a good purchase!

Good fun, not too challenging although I did find one or two objectives a bit frustrating. All I've got left to do are the time trials, the first one of which I'm finding rather tricky but I think I'll get there with a little more practice.

Edit: I found the time trials very challenging - took me 6 hours total playtime to get gold on all three!

author: {'steamid': '76561197962308126', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1575757905}
review:
TL;DR: This game is great for your kids, but if you don't have kids, don't bother.

First the good; I got this for my boys to play, who are all under the ages of 10.  They LOVE it.  They think it's the coolest thing EVER!  And you know what?  From their perspective, it is.  Even from my perspective, as a dad playing it with his kids, it's a bunch of fun.  The machines are big and you get to walk around them and look at them.  It's fun to drive them around.  There is a mini-game built into the driving of several machines that's great to occupy the youngest with while the oldest is actually playing.  All in all an enjoyable game for younger boys.

That being said, if I didn't have kids and I bought this on my own, I would be extremely disappointed.  While the machines are well modeled, the controls are very unrealistic, and the stupid mini-games that are built in while you are controlling them are annoying and make you think to yourself that in real life, there is obviously just some circuit that takes care of that stuff for you.  Furthermore, the entire game is very "rails" driven, where you can only do what the game want's you to do.  It would be nice for it to be more sand-boxy.  This is good for smaller kids who would probably get lost in a sandbox, but not great for real gamers or older kids.

Overall, I think this game is just mis-marketed.  They should be marketing it more towards kids.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041192425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1573813646}
review:
[h1] Positives [/h1]

1)A very unique and interesting idea for a simulator, where you take the place of the users of giant machines used for various industrial purposes.

2)A variety of giant machines is incorporated into the game, ranging from giant lorries, to cranes and excavators.

3)Time trial challenges are available for some missions.


[h1] Negatives [/h1]

1)The game's sounds are pretty bad; so is the soundtrack choice.

2)The graphics could be somewhat improved, being a game released in 2016.

3)Walking animation is awful;the player is bobbing an awful lot,especially when running...

4)Controls are [b] extremely [/b] complicated. Use of the control panel is a [b] must[/b].

5)The game missions become very repetitive after a while, making the game feel boring and stale.

6)The game is really short; It takes about 5 hours to complete the main story.

7)The game ending is very disappointing...


[h1] Overall opinion [/h1]

While the idea of the game has a lot of potential, the game itself has a lot of problems and weak points. I personally [b] don't [/b] recommend this game. In case you would like to try it, I recommend you do so when it is on [b] sale [/b] or if it is part of a [b] bundle[/b]. I would advise you not to consider buying it on a full price.

review:
Stay away from this developer. Case in point is here...

https://steamcommunity.com/app/402750/discussions/0/135508489634942805/

Posted some details in one of the new game forums to see if I actually get a response or a ban as expected. The reviews can't be stopped though and especially based on facts they cannot dispute. Sure, they have made their money at this point but it is worth giving others the option to see the true colors of this dev and decide for themselves.The game wasn't half bad to be honest. It was just never supported or updated as promised. To bad EA has to go this way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098450963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1561192850}
review: The fundamentals are there but the execution is poor. Your character feels like they're running through peanut butter. The controls are just plain awful until you set them all up manually. The sound is actually worse than having no sound at all. The machine design is hilariously bad. It's like they looked at one picture of the machine and said yeah I can model that. The main missions are a joke. Heavy haulers don't dump ore in sea cans, and they don't use a crane to move those sea cans 200 feet. Shovel excavators don't break ice walls. Really a shame because they could have made an amazing game here. Maybe wait for a new version or a whole new game with the tech.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093971667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1554631405}
review:
Wonderful game! But you have to know, what to expect. It is not a sim. It's not complicated. It's an exploration game, where you just enjoy handling this giants. It's a game of process, not achievements. A journey to any industrial show on Discovery channel.
But it's short and there's nothing to do, except campaign.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013710256', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1543806902}
review:
I really love the genre. I think this game could have be absolutly awesome, but it's too short.
I completed all the missions in 3 days (1-2 hours a day)

I played a lot of simulator games of this genre and if the game was longer it would be one of my favorite.

Pro:
The world is really big
machines are well designed 
Control are fun and somehow realistic
Missons are fun and the 3 lasts are hard.

Cons:
TOO SHORT !
World is big but nothing to do in it.
There are not enough mission
No workshop integration to add mission

For 5$, it's fair.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012537091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1526846768}
review:
Amazing game. Giant machines. What else could you wished for. If you wanted to drive this humongous bobcat, now you can.
It's not real life experience, but still, pretty close.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062085771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 763, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1538551384}
review:
Very disapointing its not a simulation really the only simulation part is possibly sitting in the cabs.
The engine noise is only one level (if that makes sense) you cant hear it growl or shifting gears whilst driving these vehicles you get a radio I only recognised some of the classical music the other music I have never heard of I am glad that there is classical music in there as driving some of these machines can be frustrating at times.
Unfortunetely this is more of an arcade game driving experience and not a real world simulation I dont recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061419106', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1529919273}
review: This game, while has good premise, is extremely liniar, and offers absolutely no freedom for the player. It's a very rigid go here and do this, with no opportunity to explore or just have fun with these machines. While the machines handle and perform brilliantly, I would have liked a little more time with each one, and been able to mess around with them outside of the set missions. A "freeroam" or "sandbox" mode for this game would improve it greatly, but, as it is, I cannot reccomend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198318390055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 935, 'last_played': 1548071037}

author: {'steamid': '76561198108579847', 'num_games_owned': 1468, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1564639207}
review:
Kinda interesting game where you get to drive 8 or so big machines. There are various tasks you must complete using the different vehicles that all add up to one big event. Can be completed in a few hours, so it is pretty short.

It's really simplified, so it should be fine for anyone. There are a few really basic puzzles and a few fairly challenging bits throughout the campaign. There are 3 time trials that are just 3 of the missions but with a timer. 

There are a lot of glitches/bugs involving interracting with the environment(driving and clipping ledges, curbs, rocks, etc., and also digging). You will notice the bugs here or there, but if you do the time trials, they'll basically beat you to death costing you insane amounts of time.

All in all I got this in a bundle and I don't feel too bad about it. I mean, it's far from a top notch game and it has a lot of problems, but I've seen worse for the $2.50 I paid for the bundle. If you can get it cheap(__ < $5) or in a decent bundle, you could do worse than this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108183039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 256, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1509663509}
review:
This is a weird one. IDK. 

You operate various pieces of machinery to get the space shuttle to launch. Itâ€™s so weird that it has a story at all and the voice acting is actually not horrible. The problem is that the gameplay is just kind of boring. Most of the machines have simple mechanisms and thus, the levels are super simple and kinda just there. Plus, each machine gets used more than once but you do the same thing in each one so the variety of game play is lacking, which is bad for a game that only has 14 levels.

That being said, it ran fine, looked OK, the machines are actually huge, and the game never crashed or had super weird physics bus. The designers actually knew what they were doing too as youâ€™re expected to know what to do the second time you operate a piece of machinery which implies progress. Also, the deformation software can use work but is decent. Also, operating the crawler is actually pretty cool. 
I was kinda just meh for this one. Itâ€™s not a super realistic simulator in setting or story but tries to be realistic for controls and operation (sort of). It needed more variety in levels or challenges.

review:
Pros: good graphics, kind of realistic machines (they bounce WAY too much), decent missions.

Cons: WAY too short of a story I beat it in about 4 hours, the machines are WAY too bouncey and the sensitivity for the steering and some of the hydralic functions, the controls for the fueling and general movement are strange.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018329330', 'num_games_owned': 622, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1498562949}
review:
I cannot recommend this game, no matter at what price.
The only pro in my opinion are the perfectly desigened machines.

Other than that:
It wants to be a sim, but apart from the controls it's rather arcady.
Sounds are mostly crap, for example engine noises are way too weak (missing bass) or hydraulics noises painfully loud with headphones. 
The German translation is a joke btw, totally unusable.
The put-on (unrealistic) puzzles are nothing but a hassle.
The controls for all the more complex machines are really tiresome. Yes that might not exactly be the fault of the game as a gamepad or keyboard/mouse are simply not the optimal devices to control such machines, but there isn't any support for steering wheels and joysticks either.
The radio offers a wide range of awful music, but hey that's at least realistic.
And the worst thing, when you are supposed to load material using an excavator this simply isn't possible because almost all material chunks you take from a pile are simply disappearing through the bucket. Now loading 250 tons (game measurement) of material in almost empty bucket loads of 3-4 tons is a quite tedious job.   

All in all this game feels like a burden and is no fun at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002069169', 'num_games_owned': 4684, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1632968522}
review:
Giant Machines 2017 is an oddball, a game you'll play once but remember long after you did as a truly bizarre but strangely good experience. Really not sure at all why this has the "Simulation" tag on it as it's purely arcade. Much of what you do makes no sense, especially the bit about racing a haul truck down a deserted highway late at night as if nobody would notice lol. The game is backed up by an...interesting...choice of radio stations which (mostly unfortunately) cannot be turned off - like shockingly bad salsa music mixed with opera.

The visuals in this are mostly solid, with the in-cab views of all machines taking the cake. In larger things like the excavator or haul truck it really does feel like you're essentially driving a house around. Machine audio could really do with some equalising as parts are way too loud even just using PC speakers. The dude who directs you in every mission via walkie talkie sounds suitably rough and kind of rednecky, a nice touch.

Achievement hunters, all included for Giant Machines 2017 work just fine. A single play through of the game will take around 7.2 hours, with another hour or so to successfully finish the timed missions and 100% the game.

Easy recommend if you're a simulator fanatic who likes your games a little more offbeat. This goes on sale often for 80% off and is totally a steal at that price. I find it hard to believe the same folks who made this later made the hit Gold Rush as it feels sooo much different.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029192147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1492816022}
review: Giant Machines 2017 (GM17) is an interesting game but certainly not for everyone. You play around with about a dozen different machines in various missions. The missions are linear so there's almost zero replayability. Most of the missions are fairly interesting and almost all of them are different. It was a bit of a letdown that I found the first mission and machine the most impressing. Visually it's nothing special, but serves its purpose. It surely could look better, but these "simulator" games aren't really about visuals, or physics, but instead I'd say they're interactive "how it's done" software. Audio is okay, only the 'murica voice acting is too over the top for my taste. I generally liked GM17, but for the regular price (I got it for free), I'd wish for way more content. I usually play games at a leisure pace, and it lasted less than 6 hours. For 20 Euros, it's too little content in my opinion. If you still have a small boy somewhere in your soul, you might like it. No real action, just moving around big machines. Well, except some kaboom moments when you mess things up.

review: At Â£14.99 (Steam) this game has a great bang for the bucks factor , I havenâ€™t really been a fan of these types of games before due to the developers either not giving me enough detail in the graphics or extremes in the story , but Giant Machines has hit the nail on the head with this simulator. author: {'steamid': '76561198025766645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482814359}
review:
I am recommending this game BUT, with a few reservations!

The game is a lot of fun (writing this with an hour of play on my account but have roughly 6 from another account).
It works well, mostly, and does well on simulating the massive equipment you use, close to feel that you'd get from a real life equivalent. 

I like how the terrain deformation works, the speed and weight of the vehicles is felt, and everything sounds decently accurate - EXCEPT the radio.. It is very annoying, please allow this option to be turned off or use our own music.

While everything works well and is mostly a quite enjoyable experience, there are somethings like in any game that don't work - have bugs, etc..

There are sometimes texture clips when the side of a mountain flashes in and out of existance. 
The radio as mentioned above.
Vehicles stop far too fast.
Direction arrows/goal directions sometime's dissapear.

And in my opinion the worst part about this game is the controls. In the settings, you can't much modify the sensetivity of the controls. If you turn down gamepad sensetivity, it also reduces the sensetivity of the left anolog stick.. WHAT? what game on EARTH is the movement stick a controllable sensetivity. Also modifying the controls does not always work, and general gamepad support is very poor. My regular xbox one controller will sometimes stop working in the menus and i have to leave my couch to go to the keyboard and fix it with the mouse (even tho i have controller companion).

While i do say this game is a yes - i was so excited to play giant machines, i loved doing that kind of work in real life - the controls were not perfect, nor intuitive in some cases, in game.

It is a good time, but keep in mind, it is NOT a AAA title, and can be expected to play like it. This game is extremely worth it below $20.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038570177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1480203785}
review:
Enjoyable... nothing earth shattering, but seems bug free... and the missions range from dull to interesting... and the storyline should not be taken seriously... it's kinda silly but easy enough to look past.  Unlike similar titles like Farm simulator or the Trucking sims... you can die from numerous, sometimes funny consequences.

It adds a couple of minor puzzles as well... making it an odd mix of genres. 

It's not sandboxy enough to really "play" in... it's pretty much on rails.

In the end, it's pretty short... done in 8 hours, even with a bit of screwing around... but I enjoyed it the entire time.

review:
I was very sceptical about this game and the first chapter didn't spoil me at all.

However later in the game I discovered how much I enjoyed it.
No detail was spared in the design and mechanics of the machines so you kinda nevermind some small imperfections elsewhere.

Is there room for improvement? Sure.
But I find the experiance worth of the money.

Peace

author: {'steamid': '76561198021708842', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1478637395}
review:
I'm not big fan of games like this, but playing this game is a good experience.
Player feels so tiny standing close to machines. There's so many vehicles and operating machines requires a lot of skill so sometimes it's hard to compete quest, but I like it. Sounds and music are enjoyable too. Narrator has funny voice. :D
It works on ultra settings on my laptop so it's well optimized.
I recommend this game especially for people who like simulators but I think other people will have fun too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993208787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1478119678}
review:
You are the last man alive and must single-handedly prepare the nationless space shuttle for launch in order to escape the sterile and lonely apocolypse...

I found this game very charming from the schitzofrenic radio selection to the weightless dump truck tornado chases.  To be fair, all the equipment feels pretty good as long as it's moving slower than 10km/h. Had a fine time beating the campaign.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061047030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1476936803}
review:
Giant Machines 2017 is a game about the jobs that we think are so cool, but like most cool jobs, they turn out to be dull. You take control of multiple giant rigs and control them to try and complete objective after objective. Watch out, though, the more pressure you put on these machines, the more likely you are to implode.

Pros:
+ Realistic machines
+ Genuine fun moments
+ Great Concept

Cons:
- Empty world
- Tedius gameplay
- lack of consistency 

You can find my full review here http://www.keengamer.com/article/14561_giant-machines-2017-review

author: {'steamid': '76561198238969408', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1476031531}
review:
Giant Machines 2017 is what happens when someone really good at game dev has a brilliant idea, works on it for a weekend, then kinda loses enthusiasm and puts it on the backburner.

At it's heart, the game is fantastic. It has reasonably good graphics, it has TERRAIN DEFORMATION (serious props on that one), and whilst the physics is a bit dodgy, most things seem to be physics objects which is a nice touch.

However, there's really not much of a game. Most of the time you seem to be taking a long time to just do the same things over and over again, very, very slowly. I can see this being fun for anyone REALLY into these things, but for anyone else, it's really just a bit of a bore. KSP is better if this is the sorta thing you're interested in.

Overall, this is the best bad game I've ever played, but I still can't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970852139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1475727019}
review:
I'll keep this short since I agree with a lot of the other reviews here.

This is a tough one because I enjoyed it, but it would sort of be hard to recommend.  I think if you watch the trailer or a youtube video and it really grabs you, you'd probably be into it.  And at the current sale price of $16, but probably not for $20.

I would've liked to see this come out as an early access title.  Some areas are really polished for a budget title, but there are some strange problems elsewhere.  And there's not really a lot there.  It feels sort of like a mobile game on steroids.  Well, it was on steroids, but then it didn't eat right or hit the gym often enough.  There isn't enough meat on these bones.  There isn't really an overarcing 'game' to what you're doing, you just do a few different things in different areas.  But it also doesn't work as a sim because there isn't nearly enough depth to anything you do.

But...  I still had fun.  And I kept coming back to it, though it was pretty short.  I could give it several dozen tiny nitpicks, but I noticed those things becuase I still like it and I want it to be better.  It just isn't there yet.  Hopefully the developers keep on polishing this one, and they can really blow peoples minds with Giant Machines 2018.

review:
Wish i could give this game a 50/50 score.
Its neiter good or bad. Its just ok.
Id say its more of a "app" type game than a simulator. 
Sort of a kids game you'd find on a ipad or similar.
Controls are to simple and clunky.
If your 7 years old and into big machines this is the game for you. If your into simulation games id steer clear.
Ive give it a thumbs up as it entertained me for a while but soon grew bored of it after sliding off the arm of the machine for the 10th time while coming out of the pop up instuctions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006065608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1475635753}
review:
If you are expecting a reaslistic experience don't buy this. If you want slow paced unrealistic time waster then buy it.
I got caught in by all the great reviews, was thinking even if was somewhat reaslistic I would like it, but it suck monkey caulk. 

constant game glitchs & crashing.


Pros
Epic texas style voice acting
Details are good, but not great
lots of types of machines

cons
No character models 
Some tasks seem pointless & weird
lots of bugs, glitchs and crashes
Lack of content (could easily beat in 7hrs got half achivments in 90mins)
FPS droppage on decent pc 
Unrealistic/simplistic controls 
machines damage not accurate
very odd controls
weird tasks (bleeding off pressure, setting voltage and replacing hoses/wires that look the same)

PC spec
FX8350 
r9 390 3gb
16gb ram
500 ssd

author: {'steamid': '76561198093285940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1476834169}
review:
Pour tout ceux qui rÃªvaient d'essayer un jour ces Ã©nooormes engins, ce jeu est lÃ  pour Ã§a.
Il ne faut pas hÃ©siter, c'est ce que j'ai fait, je m'amuse beaucoup hÃ©las, il est loin d'Ãªtre parfait... 
Pour moi le gros dÃ©faut vient des environnements qui ne sont pas trÃ¨s Ã©tendus ce qui donne souvent l'impression d'Ã©voluer dans un dÃ©cor, cette impression est accentuÃ©e par des dÃ©placements qui se limites Ã  quelques centaines de mÃ¨tres tout au plus. 
Dans certaines missions on doit voyager Ã  travers les Etats-Unis
et l'on est donc trÃ¨s trÃ¨s loin de cette sensation d'immensitÃ© et de libertÃ©, dommage ! 
Les missions permettent d'essayer tout un panel de vÃ©hicules assez impressionnants mais elles sont trop linÃ©aires et manquent de profondeur. On s'ennuie parfois car il faut actionner des boutons, batteries etc...avant de prendre les commandes des engins, tout Ã§a pour augmenter la durÃ©e de vie car elle semble assez courte ( je n'ai pas encore terminÃ© mais en 6 Ã  7 heures on devrait en avoir fait le tour ). 
Par contre, les graphismes sont assez soignÃ©s, les vÃ©hicules trÃ¨s bien dÃ©taillÃ©s
( hormis certaines choses comme les plaques d'immatriculation allemandes aux States...? ),
la cinÃ©matique des engins est spectaculaire, l'ambiance sonore est pas mal du tout mais Ã§a manque un peu de volume au niveau des moteurs...
Le jeu est quand mÃªme assez fun et certaines missions nÃ©cessitent une certaine adresse, on en redemande ! Il manque donc une vingtaine de missions supplÃ©mentaires pour faire "sÃ©rieux" ainsi qu'un monde plus vaste qui permettrait beaucoup plus de libertÃ© de mouvements pour apprÃ©cier ce jeu Ã  sa juste valeur et les machines surdimensionnÃ©es qu'il propose.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014659127', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1481197746}
review:
This is not a sponsored review

I like this game. As soon as I found myself in the control house for a giant bucket wheel excavator, I knew it was going to be good. So far I have snipped logs with the biggest scissors ever made, mined raw silicate with an industrial ferris wheel,  cleared snow, crushed ice walls, and carried lumps of plutonium in my hands. I was going to say that a machine is only as big as the human driving it, but that sounds silly when you stand next to your dump truck and you don't even reach the hubcap. On a technical level, the controls are great, and the graphics are too. The sounds is as good as you want it for the things that are happening. These machines don't have great sounding engines. The game helps you along nicely, and I never got lost or stuck. I didn't encounter any glitches or game breaking bugs. No game crashes either. The guy that gives objectives is pretty cool. I like his accent. Overall, I think this is a great game for people who are intersted in sims, and the machines featured, but find most sims of this nature a bit full on. This one isn't, and is a great game to cut your teeth on, before you move on, not up, to the construction sims, which incidentally have worse controls and are far more glitchy. Anyway, I heartily recommend this game. A high point was standing in the pouring rain at night, refueling my dump truck. I will remember that for some time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993235960', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1500958026}

It's pretty good, but one area that need massive work is controls.  I tried to setup my HOTAS (Saitek X55 Rhino), and it was a disasterous mess.  It would also be nice to setup controls inside the game.

I look forward to further enhancements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084294175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1477260591}
review: Oh my god. This game is amazing. I thought I would be one of those games that gets forgotten but I was was wrong. The point of this game as far as I have gotten it to follow a story and be able to use all kind of machines all different shapes and sizes. I love this game and for they money that you pay it it going to be worth it. It will also help they developers make this game better. For a game that has just come out like a few days ago it is very good and seems like it has been out for years because of the work people have put into this. So if you like massive things and a challenge this is the game for you and I highly recommend it.

review:

-Vue a la 3e personne : On voit un vehicule avec un volant tournÃ©. ( On incarne pas de personnage en fait? ) 
-On n'aperÃ§oit aucun piÃ©ton, croise aucun vÃ©hicule ( Pas de vie dans la vie ) 
-Pas de niveau de difficultÃ©
-Juste une histoire en plusieurs Ã©pisodes ( 14 ) 
-La traduction est a revoir

Les plus : 

-DÃ©tails des machines assez bien reussi ( Les manettes bougent bien en fonctions de nos actions, ainsi qu'avec les boutons ex : Phares ) 
-Details caractÃ©ristiques des vÃ©hicules IRL dans le garage
-Meme si l'histoire est courte ca ma vraiment plus de decouvrir et de jouer avec les machines.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971027454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1475349489}
review:
Attention simulation.
VoilÃ , ce "jeu" permet d'experimenter la conduite de quelques unes des plus grosses machines du monde qu'on peut voir dans certaines Ã©missions de la TNT.
Vous suivrez un scÃ©nario improbable qui va vous guider pendant environs 6 heures de la terre Ã  la lune (enfin presque).

C'est plutÃ´t bien rÃ©alisÃ©, je n'ai pas rencontrÃ© personnellement de problÃ¨mes. C'est plus ou moins joli, ca ne rame pas, l'interface est simple et les controles ne posent pas de problÃ¨me, Ã  part bien sur le problÃ¨mes habituel des claviers franÃ§ais non reconnu (c'est pour ca qu'il faut programmer un clavier anglais et jouer du SHIFT+MAJ comme d'habitude).
Le contrÃ´le ressemble a celui des Construction Simulator mais avec une interface qui se fait discrete.
La traduction est correcte avec quelques petites erreurs (mais pas plus qu'un dÃ©veloppeur franÃ§ais :) ).

Bref, sympathique tant que c'est moins de 20â‚¬ (16â‚¬ en ce moment), Ã  condition d'aimer les simus, pour animer un aprÃ¨s -midi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027135386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1475352221}
review:
This is not simulating anything at all, other then running around on ladders. While the machines may be "giant", they are also slow, awkard to control and super boring. Most of the time you are going from point A to point B. At a super slow speed.

One of the missions you are driving a giant dump truck. It starts with you refueling it (Walk up to an hose, press X, walk 1 meter to the truck, press X, walk to the valve, press X), then you drive it for 300 meters and come up to an narrow pass which has been blocked by some logs. Now the game gives you some kind of giant-sciscors-machine that you use to snip of the logs, which takes about 1 minute, and then you continue driving your dump truck. Your destination? A "trucker motel". Why is this gigantic, super wide, ultra heavy machine allowed on public roads? No idea. 
After about 30 seconds of exciting driving you arrive at the motel, unfortunately you can't stop there to rest because all of a sudden there is TORNADOES. Yes, you are being "chased" by tornadoes, on a road going through what could only be described as some kind of post-apocalyptic asset from the Unity Store.

There is nothing about this whole scenario that is even remotly close to being something which could be called a simulator. 

Nice idea, falls short on the execution.

review:
Kurzfassung: fÃ¼r 15,99â‚¬ im Angebot und fÃ¼r Fans von groÃŸen Maschinen auf jeden Fall ein Muss!
9/10

Langfassung: Ich hab ein wenig Ã¼berlegt bevor ichs gekauft hab. Dann kam mir der Gedanke, dass ich es ja 2 Stunden lang spielen kann :D also kauf ichs mal. Die erste Mission war schon grafisch (ultra) und technisch so geil, dass ich es innerhalb von fast 5 Stunden durchgezockt hab. 
Ich wusste nicht, ob es mir gefallen wird und ob es sich lohnt, es zu spielen. Als ich dann die Mschinen, die Umgebungen und die AtmosphÃ¤re gesehen habe, war der Hype real.
Es macht mega Laune und ist ein absolut geniales Abenteuer.

Negativer Punkt 1: Was mir noch fehlt ist ein Editor fÃ¼r eigene Maps und Missionen, die man auch teilen/spielen kann. 
Negativer Punkt 2: Die 14 Missionen sind lustig und ereignisreich (Rakete...xD), fÃ¼r mich aber etwas zu wenige.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053887757', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1527236380}
review:
N'achetez pas ce jeu.
Je commence directement, ne l'achetez pas.
J'adore les simulations, surtout celles d'engins.
Quand j'ai vu qu'en plus on pouvais conduire le Bagger 288, je me suis jetÃ© dessus. La douche froide est venue vite. Plus exactement au bout de 2h de jeux (sur 5 car oui, j'en ai que 5 mais vu que j'ai fini le jeu et qu'il n'a aucune rejouabilitÃ©...).

Ok, graphiquement, c'est trÃ¨s beau. Ok, les engins sont bien modÃ©lisÃ©s, les radios (au dÃ©but) sont sympas. Mais il n'a que Ã§a pour lui.
Le jeu est composÃ© de 14h missions qui se bouclent en 15 Ã  30 minutes chacunes. Personnelement, j'ai mis 5h pour le finir en galÃ©rant bien sur deux missions.
Chaques missions est composÃ© de "va a tel point, et utilise l'engin". Et... c'est tout. Ha si, parfois vous aurez un semblant de scenario du style "va sauver les bidons de l'incendit" ou "conduit vite pour echapper aux tornades (le rapport avec un jeu de machine gÃ©ante ?)".
La physique est en carton. Mais litteralement. Tout est en carton. Les vÃ©hicules ultra leger, les rochers, la fusÃ©e spatiale (son transport vous fera dailleur hurler tellement ce truc se renverse facilement).

En bref, le jeu est frustrant. Tant sur son contenu (car 5h de jeu pour 20 balles...) que sa physique qui rendra certaines missions totalement alÃ©atoire, particuliÃ©rement le transporteur de fusÃ©e.

Quand Ã  la rejouabilitÃ©... ben y en a aucune. A part refaire les 14 missions ou les 3 times attacks (qui sont en fait 3 missions chronomÃ©trÃ© mais avec un timing sÃ©rrÃ©, limite impossible Ã  cause de l'alÃ©atoire du jeu...), ben le jeu est terminÃ© :/

En bref : ne l'achetez pas. Du moins Ã  ce prix la.

C'est dommage, il avait des choses pour lui...

Mais le game play est super
AprÃ¨s avoir fait tous les missions, en moins de 8h de jeu, il n'y a plus rien a faire a part recommencer les meme missions, c'est vachement cours en durÃ©e de vie pour un jeu 
J'espÃ¨re que les developpeurs, nous donnerons la possibilitÃ© d'exploitÃ© des mines a ciel ouvert avec tous les machines miniÃ¨res et d'exploiter aussi la base de la fusÃ©e spatiale ou autre endroit

author: {'steamid': '76561198020125851', 'num_games_owned': 15680, 'num_reviews': 840, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1477704239}
review:
[h1]World's Largest Industrial Machines Simulator[/h1]
https://youtu.be/4TGa3Hj0MZc
+ Gameplay is great fun (for a simulator) and most objectives are not too grindy or time consuming. You are essentially the operator for a number of very LARGE machines and must do a variety of tasks such as mining, plowing, hauling, cutting, transporting, and so fourth. 
+ Each mission is tied together to the ultimate goal of launching a space shuttle which I found to be very rewarding and makes you actually want to progress.
+ Controls are fantastic! Most simulators are so complicated, but this game makes everything easy to understand and learn without feeling any frustration. (I used a Xbox controller)
+ The sense of scale with these behemoth machines is thrilling, they are all HUGE
+ Every vehicle has a radio with a fantastic playlist of songs / channels to listen to while you play. (this truly does add a lot to the game)
+ Visually the game looks great with a number of areas to visit each wither their own unique environment.
+ The physics and ground deformation is rather amazing and really makes the game feel realistic.
+ Some parts are rather challenging. There's one section where you have to transport the space shuttle to the launch station using a large moveable platform crawler. You have to adjust the pitch of the platform while moving to avoid the space shuttle from tilting and falling off. This was so difficult, but at the same time so rewarding when I finally finished.
+ Plenty of content. You may think "only 14 missions?" there's plenty here to keep you entertained for hours.

- Sometimes objectives are overly long and a bit tiresome to complete.
- I noticed the two "Missiouri" missions were almost copy / pasted as both include you transporting a hauling truck through tornados. I wish they would have changed it up as I did not like playing the same thing twice.
- The ending is terrible and horribly lazy. The developers just put a IRL video of a space shuttle taking off...could have just watched that on Youtube...

author: {'steamid': '76561198019482588', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1475193352}
review:
Decent game if you have a liking for sims.  Machines are represented accurately enough to instill a bit of awe when you see them the first time.  Accuracy is relatively small, but expected since you can't have a full working crew in a single player game.  It feels silly running some of these machines by yourself...

There is really just 1 major con...

You help launch a space shuttle in a game titled Giant Machines 2017, but the space shuttle program ended in 2011.  But hey, suspension of believe :P

[table][tr][th][h1][b]FR[/b][/h1][/th][th][h1][u]DÃ©couverte[/u] : [/h1][/th][th] V 0.1[/th][/tr][/table]

[quote][i]C'est un jeu que l'on m'a prÃªtÃ© par partage familial afin que j'en fasse une Ã©valuation. Je ne l'aurai pas achetÃ© de moi-mÃªme sinon et je remercie donc cette personne. Je n'ai pas voulu faire mon Ã©valuation dÃ¨s hier soir et ai prÃ©fÃ©rÃ© rejouer afin de continuer le jeu, et pousser d'autres aspect que j'expliquerai dans la partie contenu. Au final je l'ai donc achetÃ© pour faire cette Ã©valuation.[/i][/quote]

[table][tr][th][h1][b]Description & Gameplay.[/b][/h1][/th][/tr][/table]

C'est un jeu de simulation, vue FPS avec possibilitÃ©s de vues diffÃ©rentes dans les vÃ©hicules ; permettant de dÃ©couvrir et de faire fonctionner quelques GRANDES machines industrielles.

L'objectif est de faire dÃ©coller une fusÃ©e et pour cela vous allez passer par toutes les Ã©tapes ou presque depuis le minage du silicium jusqu'Ã  la mise en place d'Ã©lements dans la fusÃ©e.

Peu Ã©vident de prime abord, on s'habitue aux dÃ©placements et maniement des diffÃ©rents vÃ©hicules assez rapidement. (Pas de possibilitÃ© de rÃ©gler la sensibilitÃ©. Mais c'est prÃ©vu dans une prochaine maj^^ )
[quote][i]"X" et "Espace" sont les touches maÃ®tresses pour dÃ©marrer tout vÃ©hicule mais leur maniement s'avÃ¨re souvent compliquÃ©. [spoiler]Il faudra mÃªme dÃ¨s le premier GROS vÃ©hicule changer de poste de pilotage Ã  3 reprises.[/spoiler][/i][/quote]

Se jouant comme un FPS, vous Ãªtes trÃ¨s limitÃ¨s dans vos sauts, transformant tout Ã©ventuels raccourcis comme une trÃ¨s mauvaise idÃ©e menant Ã  la mort.

En parlant de la mort, notez que l'on meurt facilement dans ce jeu et qu'il y a un succÃ¨s liÃ© ;)


[table][tr][th][h1][b]Ambiances sonores et graphismes.[/b][/h1][/th][/tr][/table]

Sous Unity, le jeu n'est pas exceptionnel, mais il reste trÃ¨s bien fait. Des graphismes simple et rÃ©alistes avec des ombres et lumiÃ¨res efficaces.

La bande son est juste excellent selon moi, avec plusieurs possibilitÃ©s de radio allant de la country Ã  l'electro ^^

[table][tr][th][h1][b]Le contenu.[/b][/h1][/th][/tr][/table]

Plus d'une dizaines de missions et vÃ©hicules et des cartes steam, c'est dans l'ensemble peu, mais suffisant comme base. M'est avis que la durÃ©e de vie du jeu est largement Ã©xagÃ©rÃ©e par la lenteur desdites machines.
Toutefois, il existe un mode Ã©preuve contre la montre que je n'ai pas pu explorer.
A savoir que le dÃ©vellopeur parle dÃ©jÃ  de DLC alors que les joueurs rÃ©clament un mode sandbox, Ã  suivre donc.
 
[table][tr][th][h1][b]Conclusion.[/b][/h1][/th][/tr][/table]

Pour faire simple le jeu est sympa, plutÃ´t joli avec une excellente BSO, mais selon moi il ne vaut pas 20â‚¬. Est-ce qu'il en vaut 16? A l'heure actuelle je suis sceptique. Si vous Ãªtes fan des GROS engins, ou que vous Ãªtes un inconditionnel des Simulateur allez-y.


D'ici les soldes de noÃªl peut-Ãªtre. 
Il y aura eu plus de contenu normalement et surtout des corrections de bugs, ajouts de fonctionnalitÃ©s etc.

[quote][i]On apprÃ©cie la mise en place d'un forum organisÃ© sur Steam depuis aujourd'hui avec des dÃ©vellopeurs qui rÃ©pondent et qui rÃ©flÃ©chissent Ã  la suite.
On regrette la prÃ©sence de moto que l'on ne peut pas conduire.
On apprÃ©cie l'effort fait d'avoir le jeu en "FranÃ§ais" malgrÃ© les fautes et tournures bizarres.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034987548', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1475255820}
review:
Sehr gut gemachte Simulation. ABER nur was fÃ¼r Fans von groÃŸen Baumaschinen. FÃ¼r mich persÃ¶nlich ist das garnichts, dennoch gebe ich eine Empfehlung.

Das Spiel ist gut umgesetzt und die Grafik stellt einige Simulatoren aus diesem Genre gut und gerne in den Schatten.
Eine deutsche Ãœbersetzung ist vorhanden, aber an einigen Stellen etwas fehlerhaft. Das stÃ¶rt aber nicht wirklich.
Etwas stÃ¶render ist da doch schon die Steuerung von einigen Fahrzeugen. Sobald das Fahrzeug schneller als 30km/h fahren kann, wirkt die Steuerung schnell mal als ob man Ã¼ber einen gefrorenen See fÃ¤hrt.

Es wird aus der Ego-Perspektive ein nicht vorhandener Charakter gesteuert.  In den Fahrzeugen lÃ¤sst sich die Kamera-Perspektive umschalten, eine Person die das Fahrzeug bedient/fÃ¤hrt ist jedoch nicht vorhanden. Auch die Umgebung ist komplett leer, keine anderen Fahrzeuge oder Personen.

Also ich empfehle dieses Spiel zwar, da es fÃ¼r Fans von solchen Simulatoren ganz gut gemacht ist und der Preis auch vÃ¶llig in Ordnung ist. Wenn man aber wie ich, etwas mehr Spieltiefe erwartet, wird man vermutlich enttÃ¤uscht.

Macht kein SpaÃŸ, ist langweilig und die Physik ist sehr primitiv. Schrott! Keine SIMULATION. Grafik auf Ultra sieht voll 2008 aus. 
Es sind normale Spiele, die einfach Ã¼berdimensional sind. Der Kipper z.B. ist doppelt so breit, wie die StraÃŸe und genauso groÃŸ wie ein 2 stÃ¶ckiges Haus.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970615273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1475252911}
review:
So incredible frustrating some times. I gave up at the shuttle transport, because the shuttle is falling off no matter how I drive or raise/lower the platforms. Too bad I spent 3.2 hours in it, or I would have asked for a refund.

This isn't a game, but more like a demonstration of the vehicles. And the physics is way off at some points, i.e. when you bump a tow truck while walking. I manage to move it around just by walking into it. You get little information at times. I had put on a hazmat suit when I picked up and fixed the T-Rex hoses, and after doing all the stuff I had to do to start the machine, I am told I can't use a hazmat suit while driving... have to lower the ladder and climb down, take off the suit, go back and climb up, raise the ladder, open/close a door and THEN I could drive. And if I am unlucky the physics break my T-Rex and I have to start all over. In some missions you think you are going to a point, and when you get there you are told you need to step on it to avoid tornadoes. More than one time!

ATM I would give this game a 3/10 and not recommend buying. I find it boring.
